meanings.definition: Relating to or containing alkyl groups.
meanings.sent1: The alkylic compound had a strong odor.
meanings.sent2: The chemist studied the alkylic properties of the substance.
meanings.sent3: The alkylic solution danced in the test tube, creating colorful patterns.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was as alkylic as the vibrant colors on her canvas.
meanings.sent5: The alkylic nature of the compound made it easily flammable.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or being an alkane.
meanings.sent1: The alkylic chain in the molecule was long and straight.
meanings.sent2: Alkylic hydrocarbons are commonly found in petroleum products.
meanings.sent3: The alkylic structure of the molecule resembled a long snake winding through the formula.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor was as alkylic as the still waters of a lake.
meanings.sent5: The alkylic bonds in the compound provided stability and structure.
